description: In this series, we are going to learn the basics of using the command-line interface. If you have ever been scared when the cursor shows up on a seemingly blank screen or wondered what the Terminal or cmd application can accomplish, then stay tuned to learn the basics and increase your productivity.
descriptionMD: In this series, we are going to learn the basics of using the command-line interface. If you have ever been scared when the cursor shows up on a seemingly blank screen or wondered what the Terminal or cmd application can accomplish, then stay tuned to learn the basics and increase your productivity.
name: Getting Technical with the Terminal
subtitle: Comfort with the Command-line

episodes.description: In this series, we are going to learn the basics of using the command-line interface. If you have ever been scared when the cursor shows up on a seemingly blank screen or wondered what the Terminal or cmd application can accomplish, then stay tuned to learn the basics and increase your productivity.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:10.000
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:12.954 --> 00:00:15.455
Hello and welcome to
Getting Technical with the Terminal.

3
00:00:15.455 --> 00:00:19.379
Here to help us explain what this series
is all about is Mr. Justin Dennison.

4
00:00:19.379 --> 00:00:22.623
So Justin, what are we going
to be learning about in this

5
00:00:22.623 --> 00:00:25.428
series?
>> Well, the main goal of this series is

6
00:00:25.428 --> 00:00:30.367
to remove some of the fear that happens
when we remove the GUI interface, right?

7
00:00:30.367 --> 00:00:35.258
The graphical user interface from our
interactions with the computer and learn

8
00:00:35.258 --> 00:00:40.640
a little bit about how to create folders,
create files, move folders and files.

9
00:00:40.640 --> 00:00:44.590
Navigate around without the point and
click that we're all so

10
00:00:44.590 --> 00:00:48.300
use to in an effort, well,
to make us a little more productive, and

11
00:00:48.300 --> 00:00:52.080
to make us comfortable in case we ever
have to encounter that environment again.

12
00:00:52.080 --> 00:00:53.860
>> All right, well, that sounds exciting.

13
00:00:53.860 --> 00:00:55.650
So who is this intended for?

14
00:00:55.650 --> 00:00:57.530
What's our target audience here?
>> Well,

15
00:00:57.530 --> 00:01:01.740
this target audience is definitely,
you've never been in a terminal, right?

16
00:01:01.740 --> 00:01:04.904
You have never seen what
the command line interface or

17
00:01:04.904 --> 00:01:10.190
just this basic interface with no GUI
application, you've never seen it before.

18
00:01:10.190 --> 00:01:11.275
And if you're part of that,

19
00:01:11.275 --> 00:01:13.550
then that's our ultimate goal
is to make you comfortable.

20
00:01:13.550 --> 00:01:16.790
Allow you to understand what's going on,

21
00:01:16.790 --> 00:01:21.730
and create a modicum of proficiency.
>> Well, it sounds like the perfect

22
00:01:21.730 --> 00:01:24.310
series for me because that's
where I would need to start.

23
00:01:24.310 --> 00:01:27.825
So is this geared towards
any type of certification or

24
00:01:27.825 --> 00:01:33.915
technical body that I can take a test for?
>> This is not certification-based,

25
00:01:33.915 --> 00:01:36.468
this is more about, well,
learning a little more so

26
00:01:36.468 --> 00:01:38.840
we can continue our progression, right?

27
00:01:38.840 --> 00:01:41.158
If you want to learn how to
become a proficient developer,

28
00:01:41.158 --> 00:01:43.918
well, you're probably gonna end up
in a terminal from time to time.

29
00:01:43.918 --> 00:01:47.462
And this is targeted towards you,
to dip our toes into the water and

30
00:01:47.462 --> 00:01:48.610
get things rolling.

31
00:01:48.610 --> 00:01:51.999
And if that sounds like a set of skills
that you're ready to embark on, well,

32
00:01:51.999 --> 00:01:52.949
I'll see you there.

33
00:01:52.949 --> 00:02:00.278
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore the terminal environment that are necessary to really dig deep into the development world. Justin provides an overview of the terminal, terminal emulator, and shell.
episodes.title: What is the Terminal?

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne explore how to access the terminal environment as well as how to augment the terminal environment.
episodes.title: Opening the Terminal

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne take a look at how to navigate around on the system when you are in the terminal environment. Justin takes time to give tips about how to most efficiently use the terminal environment.
episodes.title: Navigating in the Terminal

episodes.description: In this episode, Justin and Vonne further expand on how to use the terminal environment to create folders and files as well as how to move those folders and files and delete folders and files.
episodes.title: Making Folders and Files
